verses.verse: To the chief <WH5329> Musician, <WH5329> A Psalm of David. <WH1732> In the LORD <WH3068> put I my trust: <WH2620> how <WH349> say <WH559> you to my soul, <WH5315> Flee <WH5110> as a bird <WH6833> to your mountain? <WH2022>

For, see, <WH2009> the wicked <WH7563> bend <WH1869> their bow, <WH7198> they make ready <WH3559> their arrow <WH2671> on the string, <WH3499> that they may privately <WH652> shoot <WH3384> at the upright <WH3477> in heart. <WH3820>
If <WH3588> the foundations <WH8356> be destroyed, <WH2040> what <WH4100> can the righteous <WH6662> do? <WH6466>

The LORD <WH3068> is in his holy <WH6944> temple, <WH1964> the LORD's <WH3068> throne <WH3678> is in heaven: <WH8064> his eyes <WH5869> behold, <WH2372> his eyelids <WH6079> try, <WH974> the children <WH1121> of men. <WH120>
The LORD <WH3068> tries <WH974> the righteous: <WH6662> but the wicked <WH7563> and him that loves <WH157> violence <WH2555> his soul <WH5315> hates. <WH8130>

On the wicked <WH7563> he shall rain <WH4305> snares, <WH6341> fire <WH784> and brimstone, <WH1614> and an horrible <WH2152> tempest: <WH7307> this shall be the portion <WH4521> of their cup. <WH3563>
For the righteous <WH6662> LORD <WH3068> loves <WH157> righteousness; <WH6666> his countenance <WH6440> does behold <WH2372> the upright. <WH3477>
